heaviest_rainfall.status: 36.8mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional 37.2 hour precipitation event.  At times the rain was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: Rain fell for 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 creating a new record that still lasts.  The storm produced a total of 36.8mm with a maximum intensity of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: Since 11 April 2025, the day with the most lightning strikes is 07 September 2025 when 23 were seen.

storm.status: There are no active storms in the area.  The previous storm started on 08 October 2025 and lasted 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 3.7.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwaves.status: There is not a heatwaves right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was 18 July 2025, there have been only 62 tropical nights since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (184°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (231.0°) by approximately 47.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the outside temperature (down 2.7°C) and feels like temperature (down 2.4°C).

The past week and month had observable variation in feels like temperature (up 8.8°C), dew point temperature (up 6.5°C), outside temperature (up 8.0°C), and cloud levels (up 471 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 136.7m lower than yesterday, 341.0m lower than the past week, 470.9m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 696m minimum and 1841m maximum, with an average of 1118.0m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1459.0m and 1588.9m.
cloud levels.summary: Cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times.

summary.summary: Inside; on the cooler side. Outside; chilly temperatures are forecasted. Also, low humidity will be noticeable and winds will be practically absent. A few light raindrops may fall, cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times, and it’s dark. Stable conditions are expected under a high pressure system.

washing.phrase: The current temperature is too low (3.6°C) for optimal drying conditions.  Any drying will take longer.
